00063     enum IndicatorFieldEnum {
00064       CIF_NULL = -1,         
00065       // CIF0 - Legacy Fields and CIF Enables - Starts at 0*32 = 0
00066       // CIF Key                  Bit #   Description                           (CIF,Bitmask)  <==> CIF|Shift = Enum Value
00067       CIF0_RESERVED_0 = 0,   
00068       CIF1_ENABLE,           
00069       CIF2_ENABLE,           
00070       CIF3_ENABLE,           
00071       CIF0_RESERVED_4,       
00072       CIF0_RESERVED_5,       
00073       CIF0_RESERVED_6,       
00074       CIF7_ENABLE,           
00075       CONTEXT_ASOC,          
00076       GPS_ASCII,             
00077       EPHEM_REF,             
00078       REL_EPHEM,             
00079       ECEF_EPHEM,            
00080       INS_EPHEM,             
00081       GPS_EPHEM,             
00082       DATA_FORMAT,           
00083       STATE_EVENT,           
00084       DEVICE_ID,             
00085       TEMPERATURE,           
00086       TIME_CALIB,            
00087       TIME_ADJUST,           
00088       SAMPLE_RATE,           
00089       OVER_RANGE,            
00090       GAIN,                  
00091       REF_LEVEL,             
00092       IF_OFFSET,             
00093       RF_OFFSET,             
00094       RF_FREQ,               
00095       IF_FREQ,               
00096       BANDWIDTH,             
00097       REF_POINT,             
00098       CHANGE_IND,            
00099 
00100       // CIF1 - Spatial, Signal, Spectral, I/O, Control - Starts at 1*32 = 32
00101       CIF1_RESERVED_0 = 32,  
00102       BUFFER_SZ,             
00103       VER_BLD_CODE,          
00104       V49_COMPL,             
00105       HEALTH_STATUS,         
00106       DISCRETE_IO64,         
00107       DISCRETE_IO32,         
00108       INDEX_LIST,

00114       AUX_BANDWIDTH,

00133

00137       CIF2_RESERVED_2,       
00138       RF_FOOTPRINT_RANGE,    
00139       RF_FOOTPRINT,

00163       PARENTS_SID,

00165       CITED_SID,             
00166       BIND,                  
00167       
00168       // CIF3 - Temporal, Environmental - Starts at 3*32 = 96
00169       CIF3_RESERVED_0 = 96,  
00170       NETWORK_ID,            
00171       TROPOSPHERIC_STATE,    
00172       SEA_AND_SWELL_STATE,

00201       
00202       // CIF4 - Reserved - Starts at 4*32 = 128
00203       CIF4_RESERVED_0 = 128, 
00204       /* Bits 1-31 reserved/undefined */
00205       
00206       // CIF5 - Reserved - Starts at 5*32 = 160
00207       CIF5_RESERVED_0 = 160, 
00208       /* Bits 1-31 reserved/undefined */
00209 
00210       // CIF6 - Reserved - Starts at 6*32 = 192
00211       CIF6_RESERVED_0 = 192, 
00212       /* Bits 1-31 reserved/undefined */
00213 
00214       // CIF7 - Attributes - Starts at 7*32 = 224
00215       CIF7_RESERVED_0 = 224, 
00216       CIF7_RESERVED_1,       
00217       CIF7_RESERVED_2,       
00218       CIF7_RESERVED_3,       
00219       CIF7_RESERVED_4,       
00220       CIF7_RESERVED_5,       
00221       CIF7_RESERVED_6,       
00222       CIF7_RESERVED_7,       
00223       CIF7_RESERVED_8,       
00224       CIF7_RESERVED_9,       
00225       CIF7_RESERVED_10,      
00226       CIF7_RESERVED_11,      
00227       CIF7_RESERVED_12,      
00228       CIF7_RESERVED_13,      
00229       CIF7_RESERVED_14,      
00230       CIF7_RESERVED_15,      
00231       CIF7_RESERVED_16,      
00232       CIF7_RESERVED_17,      
00233       CIF7_RESERVED_18,      
00234       BELIEF,                
00235       PROBABILITY,           
00236       THIRD_DERIVATIVE,      
00237       SECOND_DERIVATIVE,     
00238       FIRST_DERIVATIVE,      
00239       ACCURACY,              
00240       PRECISION,             
00241       MIN_VALUE,             
00242       MAX_VALUE,             
00243       STANDARD_DEVIATION,    
00244       MEDIAN_VALUE,          
00245       AVERAGE_VALUE,         
00246       CURRENT_VALUE          
00247 
00248     }; // IndicatorFieldEnum_t
00249 
00251     typedef IndicatorFieldEnum IndicatorFieldEnum_t;
00252 
00261     inline int8_t getCIFNumber (IndicatorFieldEnum_t f) {
00262       return (int8_t) ((f >> 5) & 0xFF); // divide by 32
00263     }
00264 
00273     inline int8_t getCIFBitNumber (IndicatorFieldEnum_t f) {
00274       return (int8_t) (f & 0x1F); // modulo 32
00275     }
00276 
00285     inline int32_t getCIFBitMask (IndicatorFieldEnum_t f) {
00286       return (int32_t) (0x1 << getCIFBitNumber(f)); // 1-hot bit mask for indicator field
00287     }
00288     
00299     inline IndicatorFieldEnum_t getCIFEnum(int8_t cif, int8_t bit) {
00300       return (IndicatorFieldEnum_t) (((cif & 0x7) << 5) + (bit & 0x1F));
00301     }

00489       static const int32_t CIF3_RESERVED_15_mask      = 0x00008000; // N/A (0)
00490                                                                     // For the next two, See V49.2 spec Section 9.7.2
00491       static const int32_t SHELF_LIFE_mask            = 0x00010000; // 1, 2, or 3 (same as packet tstamp based on TSI and TSF)
00492       static const int32_t AGE_mask                   = 0x00020000; // 1, 2, or 3 (same as packet tstamp based on TSI and TSF)
00493       static const int32_t CIF3_RESERVED_18_mask      = 0x00040000; // N/A (0)
00494       static const int32_t CIF3_RESERVED_19_mask      = 0x00080000; // N/A (0)
00495       static const int32_t JITTER_mask                = 0x00100000; // 2 (See V49.2 spec Section 9.7.1 for the next 8)
00496       static const int32_t DWELL_mask                 = 0x00200000; // 2
00497       static const int32_t DURATION_mask              = 0x00400000; // 2
00498       static const int32_t PERIOD_mask                = 0x00800000; // 2
00499       static const int32_t PULSE_WIDTH_mask           = 0x01000000; // 2
00500       static const int32_t OFFSET_TIME_mask           = 0x02000000; // 2
00501       static const int32_t FALL_TIME_mask             = 0x04000000; // 2
00502       static const int32_t RISE_TIME_mask             = 0x08000000; // 2
00503       static const int32_t CIF3_RESERVED_28_mask      = 0x10000000; // N/A (0)
00504       static const int32_t CIF3_RESERVED_29_mask      = 0x20000000; // N/A (0)
00505       static const int32_t TIMESTAMP_SKEW_mask        = 0x40000000; // 2 (See V49.2 spec Section 9.7.3.2)
00506       static const int32_t TIMESTAMP_DETAILS_mask     = 0x80000000; // 2 (See V49.2 spec Section 9.7.3.4)
00507 
00509       static const int32_t CTX_4_OCTETS = AIR_TEMP_mask | SEA_GROUND_TEMP_mask | HUMIDITY_mask | BAROMETRIC_PRESSURE_mask
00510                                         | SEA_AND_SWELL_STATE_mask | TROPOSPHERIC_STATE_mask | NETWORK_ID_mask;
00511       static const int32_t CTX_8_OCTETS = TIMESTAMP_DETAILS_mask | TIMESTAMP_SKEW_mask | RISE_TIME_mask | FALL_TIME_mask
00512                                         | OFFSET_TIME_mask | PULSE_WIDTH_mask | PERIOD_mask | DURATION_mask
00513                                         | DWELL_mask | JITTER_mask;
00515       static const int32_t CTX_TSTAMP_OCTETS = AGE_mask | SHELF_LIFE_mask;
00516 
00517     } END_NAMESPACE // protected_CIF3 namespace
00518 
00519     // CIF4 -- reserved/undefined
00520     // CIF5 -- reserved/undefined
00521     // CIF6 -- reserved/undefined
00522 
00525     namespace protected_CIF7 {
00526 
00528       static const int32_t CIF7_RESERVED_0_mask       = 0x00000001; // N/A (0)
00529       static const int32_t CIF7_RESERVED_1_mask       = 0x00000002; // N/A (0)
00530       static const int32_t CIF7_RESERVED_2_mask       = 0x00000004; // N/A (0)
00531       static const int32_t CIF7_RESERVED_3_mask       = 0x00000008; // N/A (0)
00532       static const int32_t CIF7_RESERVED_4_mask       = 0x00000010; // N/A (0)
00533       static const int32_t CIF7_RESERVED_5_mask       = 0x00000020; // N/A (0)
00534       static const int32_t CIF7_RESERVED_6_mask       = 0x00000040; // N/A (0)
00535       static const int32_t CIF7_RESERVED_7_mask       = 0x00000080; // N/A (0)
00536       static const int32_t CIF7_RESERVED_8_mask       = 0x00000100; // N/A (0)
00537       static const int32_t CIF7_RESERVED_9_mask       = 0x00000200; // N/A (0)
00538       static const int32_t CIF7_RESERVED_10_mask      = 0x00000400; // N/A (0)
00539       static const int32_t CIF7_RESERVED_11_mask      = 0x00000800; // N/A (0)
00540       static const int32_t CIF7_RESERVED_12_mask      = 0x00001000; // N/A (0)
00541       static const int32_t CIF7_RESERVED_13_mask      = 0x00002000; // N/A (0)
00542       static const int32_t CIF7_RESERVED_14_mask      = 0x00004000; // N/A (0)
00543       static const int32_t CIF7_RESERVED_15_mask      = 0x00008000; // N/A (0)
00544       static const int32_t CIF7_RESERVED_16_mask      = 0x00010000; // N/A (0)
00545       static const int32_t CIF7_RESERVED_17_mask      = 0x00020000; // N/A (0)
00546       static const int32_t CIF7_RESERVED_18_mask      = 0x00040000; // N/A (0)
00547       static const int32_t BELIEF_mask                = 0x00080000; // 1 (See V49.2 spec Section 9.12 rules)
00548       static const int32_t PROBABILITY_mask           = 0x00100000; // 1 (See V49.2 spec Section 9.12 rules)
00549       static const int32_t THIRD_DERIVATIVE_mask      = 0x00200000; // same as field it describes
00550       static const int32_t SECOND_DERIVATIVE_mask     = 0x00400000; // same as field it describes
00551       static const int32_t FIRST_DERIVATIVE_mask      = 0x00800000; // same as field it describes
00552       static const int32_t ACCURACY_mask              = 0x01000000; // same as field it describes
00553       static const int32_t PRECISION_mask             = 0x02000000; // same as field it describes
00554       static const int32_t MIN_VALUE_mask             = 0x04000000; // same as field it describes
00555       static const int32_t MAX_VALUE_mask             = 0x08000000; // same as field it describes
00556       static const int32_t STANDARD_DEVIATION_mask    = 0x10000000; // same as field it describes
00557       static const int32_t MEDIAN_VALUE_mask          = 0x20000000; // same as field it describes
00558       static const int32_t AVERAGE_VALUE_mask         = 0x40000000; // same as field it describes
00559       static const int32_t CURRENT_VALUE_mask         = 0x80000000; // same as field it describes
00560 
00562       static const int32_t CTX_4_OCTETS    = PROBABILITY_mask | BELIEF_mask; // These are 4 bytes regardless of field
00564       static const int32_t CTX_SAME_OCTETS = CURRENT_VALUE_mask | AVERAGE_VALUE_mask | MEDIAN_VALUE_mask 
00565                                            | STANDARD_DEVIATION_mask | MAX_VALUE_mask | MIN_VALUE_mask | PRECISION_mask 
00566                                            | ACCURACY_mask | FIRST_DERIVATIVE_mask | SECOND_DERIVATIVE_mask
00567                                            | THIRD_DERIVATIVE_mask;
00568 
00569     } END_NAMESPACE // protected_CIF7 namespace
00570 
00571   } END_NAMESPACE // namespace IndicatorFields

00592   class AbstractGeolocation : public Record {
00596     public: AbstractGeolocation (size_t len);
00597 
00599     public: AbstractGeolocation (const AbstractGeolocation &r);
00600 
00601     public: virtual string toString () const;
00602 
00606     public: inline int32_t getManufacturerIdentifier () const {
00607       return unpackInt(0) & 0x00FFFFFF;
00608     }
00609 
00614     public: inline void setManufacturerIdentifier (int32_t oui) {
00615       if ((oui & 0xFF000000) != 0) throw VRTException("Invalid OUI (%d).", oui);
00616       int32_t val = (unpackByte(0) << 24) | oui;
00617       packInt(0, val);
00618     }
00619 
00623     public: inline string getManufacturerID () const {
00624       return Utilities::toStringOUI(getManufacturerIdentifier());
00625     }
00626 
00631     public: inline void setManufacturerID (const string &oui) {
00632       if (oui.length() == 0) throw VRTException("OUI can not be null");
00633       setManufacturerIdentifier(Utilities::fromStringOUI(oui));
00634     }
00635 
00639     public: TimeStamp getTimeStamp () const;
00640 
00644     protected: virtual void setTimeStamp (const TimeStamp &ts);
00645 
00647     // Implement HasFields
00649     public: virtual int32_t   getFieldCount () const;
00650     public: virtual string    getFieldName  (int32_t id) const;
00651     public: virtual ValueType getFieldType  (int32_t id) const;
00652     public: virtual Value*    getField      (int32_t id) const __attribute__((warn_unused_result));
00653     public: virtual void      setField      (int32_t id, const Value* val);
00654   };

00682     }

00730     }
00731 
00735     public: inline void setLatitude (double val) {

00738     }
00739

00745       packInt(20, bits);
00746     }
00747 
00751     public: inline void setAltitude (double val) {
00752       int32_t bits = (isNull(val))? 0x7FFFFFFF : fromDouble32(5, val);
00753       packInt(24, bits);
00754     }
00755

00760       int32_t bits = (isNull(val))? 0x7FFFFFFF : fromDouble32(16, val);
00761       packInt(28, bits);
00762     }
00763 
00767     public: inline void setHeadingAngle (double val) {

00770     }

00786     }

00978   class GeoSentences : public AbstractGeolocation {
00980     public: GeoSentences ();
00981 
00983     public: GeoSentences (const GeoSentences &r);
00984 
00985     public: virtual string toString () const;
00986 
00987     public: inline virtual void writeBytes (const void *buffer) {
00988       // Write Counts
00989       setByteLength(8);
00990       AbstractGeolocation::writeBytes(buffer);
00991 
00992       // Size as appropriate
00993       int32_t numberOfWords = unpackInt(4);
00994       setByteLength(numberOfWords*4 + 8);
00995 
00996       // Write Data
00997       AbstractGeolocation::writeBytes(buffer);
00998     }
00999 
01003     public: inline TimeStamp getTimeStamp () const {
01004       return TimeStamp(); // no time stamp for this class
01005     }
01006 
01010     public: inline string getSentences () const {
01011       return unpackAscii(8, getByteLength()-8);
01012     }
01013 
01017     public: inline void setSentences (string s) {
01018       int32_t numberOfWords = (s.length() + 3) / 4; // round up to nearest word
01019       setByteLength(numberOfWords*4 + 8);
01020       packInt(4, numberOfWords);
01021       packAscii(8, s, numberOfWords*4);
01022     }
01023 
01025     // Implement HasFields
01027     public: virtual int32_t   getFieldCount () const;
01028     public: virtual string    getFieldName  (int32_t id) const;
01029     public: virtual ValueType getFieldType  (int32_t id) const;
01030     public: virtual Value*    getField      (int32_t id) const __attribute__((warn_unused_result));
01031     public: virtual void      setField      (int32_t id, const Value* val);
01032   };

01035   class ContextAssocLists : public Record {
01037     public: ContextAssocLists ();
01038 
01040     public: ContextAssocLists (const ContextAssocLists &r);
01041 
01042     public: virtual string toString () const;
01043 
01044     public: inline virtual void writeBytes (const void *buffer) {
01045       // Write Counts
01046       setByteLength(8);
01047       Record::writeBytes(buffer);
01048 
01049       // Size as appropriate
01050       updateByteLength(-1);
01051 
01052       // Write Data
01053       Record::writeBytes(buffer);
01054     }
01055 
01057     private: void updateByteLength (int32_t off);
01058 
01060     public: inline int32_t getSourceContextCount () const { return unpackShort(0) & 0x01FF; }
01062     public: inline int32_t getSystemContextCount () const { return unpackShort(2) & 0x01FF; }
01064     public: inline int32_t getVectorComponentCount () const { return unpackShort(4) & 0xFFFF; }
01066     public: inline int32_t getAsynchronousChannelCount () const { return unpackShort(6) & 0x7FFF; }
01068     public: inline bool getAsynchronousChannelTagsPresent () const { return (unpackShort(6) & 0x8000) != 0; }
01069 
01070     private: inline int32_t getSourceContextOffset ()           const { return 8; }
01071     private: inline int32_t getSystemContextOffset ()           const { return getSourceContextOffset()       + 4*getSourceContextCount(); }
01072     private: inline int32_t getVectorComponentOffset ()         const { return getSystemContextOffset()       + 4*getSystemContextCount(); }
01073     private: inline int32_t getAsynchronousChannelOffset ()     const { return getVectorComponentOffset()     + 4*getVectorComponentCount(); }
01074     private: inline int32_t getAsynchronousChannelTagsOffset () const { return getAsynchronousChannelOffset() + 4*getAsynchronousChannelCount(); }
01075 
01077     private: void resize (int32_t pos, int32_t max, int32_t off, int32_t old, int32_t val);
01078 
01080     public: inline void setSourceContextCount (int32_t val) {
01081       resize(0, 0x1FF, getSourceContextOffset(), getSourceContextCount(), val);
01082     }
01083 
01085     public: inline void setSystemContextCount (int32_t val) {
01086       resize(2, 0x1FF, getSystemContextOffset(), getSystemContextCount(), val);
01087     }
01088 
01090     public: inline void setVectorComponentCount (int32_t val) {
01091       resize(4, 0xFFFF, getVectorComponentOffset(), getVectorComponentCount(), val);
01092     }
01093 
01095     public: inline void setAsynchronousChannelCount (int32_t val) {
01096       resize(6, 0x7FFF, getAsynchronousChannelOffset(), getAsynchronousChannelCount(), val);
01097       if (getAsynchronousChannelTagsPresent()) {
01098         resize(6, 0x7FFF, getAsynchronousChannelTagsOffset(), getAsynchronousChannelCount(), val);
01099       }
01100     }
01101 
01103     public: void setAsynchronousChannelTagsPresent (bool val);
01104 
01108     public: vector<int32_t> getSourceContext () const;
01109 
01113     public: vector<int32_t> getSystemContext () const;
01114 
01118     public: vector<int32_t> getVectorComponent () const;
01119 
01124     public: vector<int32_t> getAsynchronousChannel () const;
01125 
01132     public: vector<int32_t> getAsynchronousChannelTag () const;
01133 
01137     public: void setSourceContext (const vector<int32_t> &val);
01138 
01142     public: void setSystemContext (const vector<int32_t> &val);
01143 
01147     public: void setVectorComponent (const vector<int32_t> &val);
01148 
01153     public: void setAsynchronousChannel (const vector<int32_t> &val);
01154 
01163     public: void setAsynchronousChannel (const vector<int32_t> &val, const vector<int32_t> &tags);
01164 
01166     // Implement HasFields
01168     public: virtual int32_t   getFieldCount () const;
01169     public: virtual string    getFieldName  (int32_t id) const;
01170     public: virtual ValueType getFieldType  (int32_t id) const;
01171     public: virtual Value*    getField      (int32_t id) const __attribute__((warn_unused_result));
01172     public: virtual void      setField      (int32_t id, const Value* val);
01173   };

01199

01201 
01203     public: inline int32_t getTotalFieldSize () const { return unpackInt(0); }
01204 
01206     public: inline int32_t getIndexEntriesCount () const { return unpackInt(4) & 0xFFFFF; }

01230 
01232     // Implement HasFields
01234     public: virtual int32_t   getFieldCount () const;
01235     public: virtual string    getFieldName  (int32_t id) const;
01236     public: virtual ValueType getFieldType  (int32_t id) const;
01237     public: virtual Value*    getField      (int32_t id) const __attribute__((warn_unused_result));

01239   };

01242   class ArrayOfRecords : public Record {
01244     public: ArrayOfRecords ();
01245 
01247     public: ArrayOfRecords (const ArrayOfRecords &r);
01248 
01249     public: virtual string toString () const;
01250 
01251     public: inline virtual void writeBytes (const void *buffer) {
01252       // Write Counts
01253       setByteLength(12);
01254       Record::writeBytes(buffer);
01255 
01256       // Size as appropriate
01257       updateByteLength();
01258 
01259       // Write Data
01260       Record::writeBytes(buffer);
01261     }
01262 
01264     private: void updateByteLength (int32_t off=-1);
01265 
01267     public: inline int32_t getTotalFieldSize () const { return unpackInt(0); }
01268 
01270     public: inline int32_t getHeaderSize () const { return ((int32_t) unpackByte(4)) & 0xFF; }
01271 
01273     public: inline int32_t getRecordSize () const { return (unpackInt(4)>>12) & 0xFFF; }
01274 
01276     public: void setRecordSize (int32_t val);
01277 
01279     public: inline int32_t getRecordCount () const { return unpackInt(4) & 0xFFF; }
01280 
01282     public: void setRecordCount (int32_t val, int32_t off=-1);
01283 
01285     public: inline int32_t getBitMappedIndicator () const { return unpackInt(8); }
01286 
01288     public: inline void setBitMappedIndicator (int32_t val) { packInt(8, val); }
01289 
01290     
01294     public: inline vector<char> getApplicationSpecificHeader () const { return unpackBytes(12, getHeaderSize()*4); }
01295 
01300     public: void setApplicationSpecificHeader (const vector<char> &val);
01301 
01310     public: void setApplicationSpecificHeader (const char* val, size_t bytes);
01311 
01316     private: inline int32_t getRecordEntriesByteOffset () const { return 12+4*getHeaderSize(); }
01317 
01325     public: vector<Record> getRecords (int32_t idx=0, int32_t num=-1) const;
01326

01391     //reserved: word 0, bits 31..20
01392

01405     public: virtual void setNumWindowPoints (int32_t val) { packInt(12, val); }
01406 
01410     public: virtual double getResolution () const {
01411       int64_t bits = unpackLong(16);
01412       return (isNull(bits))? DOUBLE_NAN : VRTMath::toDouble64(20,bits);
01413     }
01414     public: virtual void setResolution (double val) {
01415       int64_t bits = (isNull(val))? INT64_NULL : VRTMath::fromDouble64(20,val);
01416       packLong(16, bits);
01417     }
01418

01425     }

01427       int64_t bits = (isNull(val))? INT64_NULL : VRTMath::fromDouble64(20,val);
01428       packLong(24, bits);
01429     }

01433     public: virtual void setNumAverages (int32_t val) { packInt(32, val); }

01437     public: virtual void setWeightingFactor (int32_t val) { packInt(36, val); }

01445     public: virtual void setSpectrumF2Index (int32_t val) { packInt(44, val); }

01456     public: virtual double getWindowTimeDeltaFloat () const {
01457       int32_t bits = unpackInt(48);
01458       return (bits == 0x7FFFFFFF)? DOUBLE_NAN : VRTMath::toDouble32(12, bits);
01459     }
01460     public: virtual void setWindowTimeDeltaFloat (double val) {
01461       int32_t bits = (isNull(val))? 0x7FFFFFFF : VRTMath::fromDouble32(12, val);

01463     }

01478   class IndicatorFieldProvider {
01479     
01480     public: virtual ~IndicatorFieldProvider () { }
01481 
01482     /**********************************************************/
01483     /* Functions from BasicContextPacket that are CIF related */
01484     /**********************************************************/
01485 
01495     protected: virtual int32_t getOffset (int8_t cifNum, int32_t field) const = 0;
01496     protected: virtual int32_t getOffset (IndicatorFieldEnum_t field) const {
01497       return getOffset(getCIFNumber(field), getCIFBitMask(field));
01498     }
01499     // Used for getting attribute of a field, based on CIF7 attributes
01500     // A negative return value means either the field or the attribute is not present, or both.
01501     // A NULL return value means the entire CIF is not present.
01502     // @return offset to attribute of specified field
01503     // @throws VRTException when field has invalid length (size)
01504     // @throws VRTException when cif7bit is specified (non-zero) and CIF7 is not enabled
01505     protected: virtual int32_t getOffset (int8_t cifNum, int32_t field, int32_t cif7bit) const {
01506       int32_t fieldOffset = getOffset(cifNum, field);
01507       if (cif7bit == 0 || isNull(fieldOffset) || fieldOffset<0) return fieldOffset;
01508       //if (fieldOffset < 0) throw VRTException("Cannot get attribute of a field that is not present.");
01509       int32_t fieldLen = getFieldLen(cifNum, field);
01510       if (fieldLen <= 0) throw VRTException("Cannot get attribute of a field with invalid length.");
01511       int32_t cif7Offset = getCIF7Offset(cif7bit, fieldLen, cifNum&0x08);
01512       int32_t cif7length = getFieldLen(7,cif7bit, fieldLen);
01513       if (cif7Offset < 0) {
01514         if (fieldOffset > 0) fieldOffset = -fieldOffset;
01515         cif7Offset += cif7length; // adjust to be offset to start of attribute, not end
01516       } else {
01517         cif7Offset -= cif7length; // adjust to be offset to start of attribute, not end
01518         if (fieldOffset < 0) cif7Offset = -cif7Offset;
01519       }
01520       return fieldOffset + cif7Offset;
01521     }
01522     // XXX this may cause ambiguity since both args are ints, same as first getOffset defined above
01523     protected: virtual int32_t getOffset (IndicatorFieldEnum_t field, IndicatorFieldEnum_t cif7field) const {
01524       int32_t cif7bit = (getCIFNumber(cif7field) != 7) ? 0 : getCIFBitMask(cif7field);
01525       return getOffset(getCIFNumber(field), getCIFBitMask(field), cif7bit);
01526     }
01527     // Used for getting second occurrence of CIFs (i.e. Ack packets have second occurrence for errors (first is for warnings)
01528     protected: virtual int32_t getOffset (IndicatorFieldEnum_t field, bool occurrence) const {
01529       return getOffset(getCIFNumber(field) | (((int8_t)occurrence)<<3), getCIFBitMask(field));
01530     }
01531     // Combo of cif7 attributes and second occurrence
01532     // XXX - if this is only ever used with occurrence=true, replace with new function name that does it without occurrence arg
01533     protected: virtual int32_t getOffset (IndicatorFieldEnum_t field, IndicatorFieldEnum_t cif7field, bool occurrence) const {
01534       int32_t cif7bit = (getCIFNumber(cif7field) != 7) ? 0 : getCIFBitMask(cif7field);
01535       return getOffset(getCIFNumber(field) | (((int8_t)occurrence)<<3), getCIFBitMask(field), cif7bit);
01536     }
01537 
01553     protected: virtual int32_t getCIF7Offset (int32_t attr, int32_t len, bool occurrence=0) const {
01554       UNUSED_VARIABLE(attr);
01555       UNUSED_VARIABLE(len);
01556       UNUSED_VARIABLE(occurrence);
01557       // Default impl throws exception for classes that don't support CIF7
01558       throw VRTException("Class does not support CIF7.");
01559     }
01560 
01567     protected: virtual int32_t getTotalFieldSize (int32_t fieldLen, bool occurrence=0) const = 0;
01568 
01575     protected: virtual int32_t getFieldLen (int8_t cifNum, int32_t field, int32_t parent=0) const = 0;
01576     protected: virtual int32_t getFieldLen (IndicatorFieldEnum_t field, int32_t parent=0) const {
01577       return getFieldLen(getCIFNumber(field), getCIFBitMask(field), parent);

01717 
01724     protected: virtual int32_t getContextIndicatorField (int8_t cifNum) const {
01725       switch(cifNum&0xF7) { // Ignore bit 3 (occurrence)
01726         case 0: return getContextIndicatorField0(cifNum&0x08);
01727         case 1: return getContextIndicatorField1(cifNum&0x08);
01728         case 2: return getContextIndicatorField2(cifNum&0x08);
01729         case 3: return getContextIndicatorField3(cifNum&0x08);
01730         case 7: return getContextIndicatorField7(cifNum&0x08);
01731         default:
01732           throw VRTException("Invalid Context Indicator Field number.");
01733       }
01734     }
01735 
01736     // May return NULL
01737     protected: virtual int32_t getContextIndicatorField (IndicatorFieldEnum_t field, bool occurrence=0) const {
01738       return getContextIndicatorField(getCIFNumber(field) | (((int8_t)occurrence)<<3));
01739     }
01740 
01741     // These may return NULL
01742     protected: virtual int32_t getContextIndicatorField0 (bool occurrence=0) const = 0;
01743     protected: virtual int32_t getContextIndicatorField1 (bool occurrence=0) const = 0;
01744     protected: virtual int32_t getContextIndicatorField2 (bool occurrence=0) const = 0;
01745     protected: virtual int32_t getContextIndicatorField3 (bool occurrence=0) const = 0;
01746     protected: virtual int32_t getContextIndicatorField7 (bool occurrence=0) const = 0;
01747 
01753     // XXX Generic CIF bit getter XXX
01754     protected: virtual boolNull getContextIndicatorFieldBit (IndicatorFieldEnum_t field, bool occurrence=0) const {
01755       return getContextIndicatorFieldBit(getCIFNumber(field) | (((int8_t)occurrence)<<3), getCIFBitMask(field));
01756     }
01757     protected: virtual boolNull getContextIndicatorFieldBit (int8_t cifNum, int32_t bit) const {
01758       if (!isCIFEnable(cifNum)) return _NULL;
01759       int32_t cif = getContextIndicatorField(cifNum);
01760       return ((cif & bit) != 0) ? _TRUE : _FALSE;
01761     }
01762 
01767     protected: virtual void setContextIndicatorFieldBit (IndicatorFieldEnum_t field, bool set, bool occurrence=0) {
01768       setContextIndicatorFieldBit(getCIFNumber(field) | (((int8_t)occurrence)<<3), getCIFBitMask(field), set);
01769     }
01770     protected: virtual void setContextIndicatorFieldBit (int8_t cifNum, int32_t bit, bool set) {
01771       switch(cifNum&0xF7) { // Ignore bit 3 (occurrence)
01772         case 0: return setContextIndicatorField0Bit(bit, set, cifNum&0x08);
01773         case 1: return setContextIndicatorField1Bit(bit, set, cifNum&0x08);
01774         case 2: return setContextIndicatorField2Bit(bit, set, cifNum&0x08);
01775         case 3: return setContextIndicatorField3Bit(bit, set, cifNum&0x08);
01776         case 7: return setContextIndicatorField7Bit(bit, set, cifNum&0x08);
01777         default:
01778           throw VRTException("Invalid Context Indicator Field number.");
01779       }
01780     }
01781     protected: virtual void setContextIndicatorField0Bit (int32_t bit, bool set, bool occurrence=0) = 0;
01782     protected: virtual void setContextIndicatorField1Bit (int32_t bit, bool set, bool occurrence=0) = 0;
01783     protected: virtual void setContextIndicatorField2Bit (int32_t bit, bool set, bool occurrence=0) = 0;
01784     protected: virtual void setContextIndicatorField3Bit (int32_t bit, bool set, bool occurrence=0) = 0;
01785     protected: virtual void setContextIndicatorField7Bit (int32_t bit, bool set, bool occurrence=0) = 0;
01786 
01787     /* XXX START OF CIF0 FUNCTIONS XXX */
01788 
01792     public: inline bool isCIF1Enable (bool occurrence=0) const {
01793       return ((getContextIndicatorField0(occurrence) & protected_CIF0::CIF1_ENABLE_mask) != 0);
01794     }
01795 
01799     public: inline bool isCIF2Enable (bool occurrence=0) const {

01813     public: inline bool isCIF7Enable (bool occurrence=0) const {
01814       return ((getContextIndicatorField0(occurrence) & protected_CIF0::CIF7_ENABLE_mask) != 0);
01815     }
01816 
01817     protected: inline bool isCIFEnable(int8_t cifNum) const {
01818       switch(cifNum&0xF7) { // Ignore bit 3 (occurrence)
01819         case 0: return true;
01820         case 1: return isCIF1Enable(cifNum&0x08);
01821         case 2: return isCIF2Enable(cifNum&0x08);
01822         case 3: return isCIF3Enable(cifNum&0x08);
01823         case 7: return isCIF7Enable(cifNum&0x08);
01824         default:
01825           throw VRTException("Invalid Context Indicator Field number.");
01826       }
01827     }
01828

01838     public: virtual void addCIF7 (bool add=true, bool occurrence=false) = 0; // TODO CIF7 - if removing, need to adjust packet massively (perhaps true for other CIFs as well)

02623     public: inline void setDeviceIdentifier (int64_t val, IndicatorFieldEnum_t cif7field=CIF_NULL) {
02624       if (!isNull(val) && ((val & ~__INT64_C(0x00FFFFFF0000FFFF)) != 0)) {
02625         throw VRTException("Invalid device identifier");
02626       }
02627       setX(DEVICE_ID,val, cif7field);

03299     public: inline double getRange (IndicatorFieldEnum_t cif7field=CIF_NULL) const {
03300       int32_t bits = getL(RANGE, cif7field);
03301       // XXX if bits==INT32_NULL, could be valid value or could be indicating Range is not set
03302       if (isNull(bits) && getOffset(RANGE, cif7field) < 0) return DOUBLE_NAN;
03303       return (bits == 0x7FFFFFFF)? DOUBLE_NAN : toDouble32(6, bits);
03304     }
03305 
03311     public: inline void setRange (double val, IndicatorFieldEnum_t cif7field=CIF_NULL) {
03312       int32_t bits = (isNull(val))? 0x7FFFFFFF : fromDouble32(6, val);
03313       setL(RANGE,bits, cif7field);
03314     }
03315 
03327     public: inline void setBeamwidth (float hval, float vval, IndicatorFieldEnum_t cif7field=CIF_NULL) {
03328       if (isNull(hval) || isNull(vval)) {
03329         setL(BEAMWIDTH, INT32_NULL, cif7field);
03330       } else {
03331         int32_t hbits = VRTMath::fromFloat32(7,hval);
03332         int32_t vbits = VRTMath::fromFloat32(7,vval);
03333         int32_t bits = (hbits<<16) | (vbits&0xFFFF);
03334         setL(BEAMWIDTH, bits, cif7field);
03335       }
03336     }
03337 
03343     public: inline float getHorizontalBeamwidth (IndicatorFieldEnum_t cif7field=CIF_NULL) const {
03344       int32_t bits = getL(BEAMWIDTH, cif7field);
03345       return (isNull(bits))? FLOAT_NAN : VRTMath::toFloat32(7,(bits>>16)&0xFFFF);
03346     }
03347 
03354     public: inline void setHorizontalBeamwidth (float val, IndicatorFieldEnum_t cif7field=CIF_NULL) {
03355       if (isNull(val)) {
03356         setL(BEAMWIDTH, INT32_NULL, cif7field);
03357       } else {
03358         int16_t bits = (int16_t)(VRTMath::fromFloat32(7,val)&0xFFFF);
03359         setI(BEAMWIDTH,0,bits, cif7field);
03360       }
03361     }
03362

03371     }

03494     public: inline float get3DPointingVectorAzimuth (IndicatorFieldEnum_t cif7field=CIF_NULL) const {
03495       int16_t bits = getI(PNT_VECT_3D_SI,2, cif7field);
03496       if (isNull(bits)) return FLOAT_NAN;
03497       float val = VRTMath::toFloat16(7,bits);
03498       return (val < 0)? 512.0+val : val;
03499     }

03532     public: inline void set3DPointingVectorAzimuth (float val, IndicatorFieldEnum_t cif7field=CIF_NULL) {
03533       if (isNull(val)) {
03534         setL(PNT_VECT_3D_SI, INT32_NULL, cif7field);
03535       } else {
03536         if (val > 255.984375) val = val-512;
03537         int16_t bits = VRTMath::fromFloat16(7,val);
03538         setI(PNT_VECT_3D_SI,2,bits, cif7field);
03539       }
03540     }

04538     public: inline int16_t getSeaAndSwellState (IndicatorFieldEnum_t cif7field=CIF_NULL) const {
04539       int16_t bits = getI(SEA_AND_SWELL_STATE, 2, cif7field);
04540       return (isNull(bits))? INT16_NULL : bits;
04541     }
04542 
04558     public: inline void setSeaAndSwellState (int16_t val, IndicatorFieldEnum_t cif7field=CIF_NULL) {
04559       if (!isNull(val)) {
04560         int8_t sea = val&0x1F;
04561         int8_t swell = (val>>5)&0x1F;
04562         if (sea < 0 || swell < 0 || sea > 9 || swell > 9)
04563           throw VRTException("Sea and Swell must both be between 0 and 9.");
04564       }
04565       setI(SEA_AND_SWELL_STATE, 2, val, cif7field);
04566     }
04567 
04568     // XXX could add set/getSeaState, set/getSwellState, set/getSeaAndSwellStateUserDefinedBits
04569 
04586     public: inline void setSeaAndSwellState (int8_t sea, int8_t swell, IndicatorFieldEnum_t cif7field=CIF_NULL) {
04587       if (isNull(sea) || isNull(swell))
04588         throw VRTException("Sea and Swell must both not be null to use this method.");
04589       if (sea < 0 || swell < 0 || sea > 9 || swell > 9)
04590         throw VRTException("Sea and Swell must both be between 0 and 9.");
04591       int16_t val = (swell<<5) | sea;
04592       setI(SEA_AND_SWELL_STATE, 2, val, cif7field);
04593     }

05091     /* XXX END OF CIF3 FUNCTIONS XXX */

05093     /* XXX START OF CIF7 FUNCTIONS XXX */
05094     public: inline void setCIF7Attribute (IndicatorFieldEnum_t cif7field, bool set, bool occurrence=false) {
05095       if (getCIFNumber(cif7field) != 7) throw VRTException("setCIF7Attribute: Invalid CIF7 field");
05096       int32_t cif7bit = getCIFBitMask(cif7field);
05097       setCIF7Bit(cif7bit, set, occurrence);
05098     }
05099     protected: virtual void setCIF7Bit (int32_t cif7bit, bool set, bool occurrence=false) = 0;
05100 
05101     // null if no cif7, true if cif7 and bit set, false if cif7 and bit not set
05102     public: inline boolNull getCIF7Attribute (IndicatorFieldEnum_t cif7field, bool occurrence=false) const {
05103       if (getCIFNumber(cif7field) != 7) throw VRTException("getCIF7Attribute: Invalid CIF7 field");
05104       int32_t cif7bit = getCIFBitMask(cif7field);
05105       return getCIF7Bit(cif7bit, occurrence);
05106     }
05107     protected: inline boolNull getCIF7Bit (int32_t cif7bit, bool occurrence=false) const {
05108       return getContextIndicatorFieldBit(7 | (((int8_t)occurrence)<<3), cif7bit);
05109     }
05110 
05122     public: inline void setCIF7Belief(IndicatorFieldEnum_t field, int32_t val) {
05123       if (!isNull(val)) val&=0x000000FF;
05124       setL(field, val, BELIEF);
05125     }
05137     public: inline int32_t getCIF7Belief(IndicatorFieldEnum_t field) const {
05138       return getL(field, BELIEF);
05139     }
05154     public: inline void setCIF7Probability(IndicatorFieldEnum_t field, int32_t val) {
05155       if (!isNull(val)) val&=0x0000FFFF;
05156       setL(field, val, PROBABILITY);
05157     }
05172     public: inline int32_t getCIF7Probability(IndicatorFieldEnum_t field) const {
05173       return getL(field, PROBABILITY);
05174     }
05175 
05176     // BELIEF_mask                = 0x00080000; // 1 (See V49.2 spec Section 9.12 rules)
05177     // PROBABILITY_mask           = 0x00100000; // 1 (See V49.2 spec Section 9.12 rules)
05178     // THIRD_DERIVATIVE_mask      = 0x00200000; // same as field it describes
05179     // SECOND_DERIVATIVE_mask     = 0x00400000; // same as field it describes
05180     // FIRST_DERIVATIVE_mask      = 0x00800000; // same as field it describes
05181     // ACCURACY_mask              = 0x01000000; // same as field it describes
05182     // PRECISION_mask             = 0x02000000; // same as field it describes
05183     // MIN_VALUE_mask             = 0x04000000; // same as field it describes
05184     // MAX_VALUE_mask             = 0x08000000; // same as field it describes
05185     // STANDARD_DEVIATION_mask    = 0x10000000; // same as field it describes
05186     // MEDIAN_VALUE_mask          = 0x20000000; // same as field it describes
05187     // AVERAGE_VALUE_mask         = 0x40000000; // same as field it describes
05188     // CURRENT_VALUE_mask         = 0x80000000; // same as field it describes
05189     /* XXX END OF CIF7 FUNCTIONS XXX */
05190 
05191 
05192   }; /* class IndicatorFieldProvider */
05193 
05194 } END_NAMESPACE /* vrt namespace */
